title: PID Synergy Exp
summary: Computed pairwise PID synergy matrices on all 12 benchmark datasets (2569 feature pairs total, 0 errors) using PID_BROJA for small datasets (≤100 pairs) and PID_MMI for larger ones, with Co-Information baseline. XOR validation passed (synergy=1.0, conservation=1.0). Key findings: low Jaccard overlap (0.0-0.36) between top synergy pairs and top MI features confirms synergy captures different information than MI. Stability analysis shows high reproducibility (breast_cancer ρ=0.952±0.008, pima ρ=0.780±0.060). Synergy graphs constructed at 75th percentile threshold. All 12 datasets from both dependency workspaces processed in ~20 minutes. Output includes full PID decomposition (synergy, redundancy, unique) per pair plus CoI baseline.
